seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is an Indian SaaS-based digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software.

pricing_models.type: Flat fee plus user license fees
pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.duration: Annual billing, term length varies based on contract

pricing_models.description: Whatfix offers a free plan with 30 credits.
Whatfix offers a basic plan at $39 per month.

buyer_research.name: Oracle
buyer_research.description: Oracle is an American multinational technology corporation that specializes in developing and marketing computer hardware systems, enterprise software products, and cloud computing.
buyer_research.industry: Technology, IT Services and IT Consulting

competitors.name: WalkMe
differentiators: Advanced features such as multi-format content publishing, analytics, automation, and support for non-Oracle apps

messages.content: Hi, I'm [Name], the sales representative from Whatfix. It's great to be speaking with you today. Can you please introduce yourself and tell me a little bit about your role at Oracle?

Hi, I'm John, the Digital Transformation Officer at Oracle. I'm responsible for overseeing the adoption of new technologies across our organization. We've been evaluating digital adoption platforms to help us drive user adoption and maximize our technology investments.

That's great to hear, John. Can you tell me more about your current pain points and challenges when it comes to digital transformation and user adoption? What are some of the specific goals you're trying to achieve?

One of the main challenges we're facing is the complexity of digital transformation. We have a large and diverse technology stack, and it's difficult to ensure that our employees are able to adopt and use these new systems effectively. We're also struggling to measure the ROI of our digital transformation efforts.

I completely understand, John. Measuring ROI can be a significant challenge. Whatfix has helped many organizations like yours simplify their digital transformation journey and drive user adoption. Can you tell me more about your current approach to user onboarding and training?

Currently, we're using a combination of in-person training sessions and self-service resources, but we're finding that it's not very effective. We're looking for a more scalable and engaging solution that can help us achieve our business outcomes.

Whatfix's digital adoption platform can help you achieve that. Our platform provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software. We've had success with many organizations in the technology industry. Can I share some case studies with you?
Yes, that would be great. I'd love to hear more about how Whatfix has helped other organizations achieve their digital transformation goals.

We've had success with many organizations, including [similar company in the technology industry]. We were able to help them increase user adoption by 30% and reduce their training costs by 25%. We've also had success with [another similar company], where we helped them achieve a 40% increase in sales productivity.
Those are impressive results. How does Whatfix's platform ensure security and compliance with our existing infrastructure and systems?

Security and compliance are top priorities for us at Whatfix. Our platform is built on a robust security framework that ensures the integrity and confidentiality of our customers' data. We're also compliant with major industry standards, including [list relevant standards].
That's great to hear. What does the implementation process look like for Whatfix's platform? How long does it typically take to get up and running?

Our implementation process is typically 4-6 weeks, depending on the complexity of the integration and the scope of the project. We work closely with our customers to ensure a smooth and successful implementation.
That sounds relatively quick. What kind of support and resources does Whatfix provide to ensure our success?

We provide a dedicated customer success manager, as well as access to our comprehensive knowledge base and community forum. We also offer regular check-ins and quarterly business reviews to ensure that our customers are achieving their desired outcomes.
That sounds like a great support model. What are the next steps if we're interested in moving forward with Whatfix?

I'd be happy to provide a customized demo of our platform, tailored to your specific use cases and requirements. After that, we can discuss pricing and implementation details. Does that sound like a good plan to you?
Yes, that sounds like a good plan. I'd like to schedule a demo for next week.
Great, I'll send over a calendar invite. Thank you for your time today, John. I'm looking forward to our next conversation.

pain_points: difficulty in ensuring employees are able to adopt and use new systems effectively
struggling to measure the ROI of digital transformation efforts
ineffective current approach to user onboarding and training
objections: security and compliance with existing infrastructure and systems

insights: Oracle is facing challenges in digital transformation and user adoption
Oracle is looking for a scalable and engaging solution to achieve their business outcomes
Whatfix has experience in helping similar organizations achieve their digital transformation goals

The seller could have provided more details about Whatfix's pricing model and implementation process
The seller could have explored more on Oracle's current approach to user onboarding and training
